Articles.Content:
Hi!

I've been learning how to make mods to KSP, and this came out of my mind:

http://zapodaj.net/1058835e525ae.bmp.html

The problem is, that it's model in game looks like that:

http://zapodaj.net/a9b3247c966ec.bmp.html

Everything else works, just model is wrong.

Thanks for help.

PS/ I know, it's very complicated texture.

I'm going to guess that the pieces at the top and bottom are separate mesh from the main body. If so make sure that after moving them you applied the movement(CTRL + A - then select position) and re-export, also this solution is for blender which it looks like that is what you are using. Hope this helps.
[MOD - Moved to Modelling and Texturing Discussion, as this is the place for this sort of stuff]
There's really not enough information to go on here.

OK, then:

-I'm using Blender

-Model is loaded to KSP in .dae

-Mod files: http://www.sendspace.pl/file/e7f4b91d2f118f93322f199

-Patonium and Stabilizer is added to game resources and works properly.

-I'm using KSP 23.5 but it should work in every version

-Texture is made in Paint.

Sorry for my English
If you upload the source files I will be able to diagnose the problem much easier. That means your blend file and Unity project.
I don't know what's Unity project source file, but there's .blend: http://www.sendspace.pl/file/7300fa07d5973d1c3242844 (press "Pobierz" in blue circle)

I don't know what's Unity project source file

I found the problem, lol!

Learn how to use Unity. You should be exporting .MU files with it. This is the way you make models for KSP, I'm shocked you don't know this. Read the Compilation of modding information in the Dev subforum.

GREAT THANKS! I exported to .dae, because it was said in tutorial.

Tutorial link: http://www.alternatewars.com/Games/KSP/Tut1/KSP_Tutorial_1-3.htm

"Exporting to DAE"

"Now we can export to DAE, which is what KSP uses."

Thanks and bye!
